result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher M Lohry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Great Harm, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to 2013CF99.  Sentence is to commence immediately.

superMiscConds.notes: No unsupervised contact with any child under age of 12 years old including his own children.

records.addlTxt:
10:04 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  State has received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Atty Selsing and defendant have received a copy of the presentence investigation report, with no corrections, additions or deletions.  Sentencing argument by ADA Vanden Branden.  Sentencing argument by Atty Selsing.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

2013CF99 (Count 1)

1 years of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision

2014CF57 (Count 2)

7 years of Initial Confinement and 4 years of Extended Supervison

Sentences are to be consecutive to each other.

CONDITIONS:

Court costs.
No unsupervised contact with any child under age of 12 years old including his own children.

Court finds the defendant not eligible for the CIP and SAR program.

Court grants the defendant sentence credit from June 16, 2014 til sentencing on 2014CF57.

Court orders the sentence to commence immediately.

Court adjourned at 10:22 a.m.
to counsel with copy of the Presentence Investigation Report
to Agent Michael Pulice - Court grants the request for extension to file the PSI.  PSI is to be filed on or before April 20, 2015.
from Agent Michael Pulice dated 04/03/2015 - requests a two week extension to file the PSI
Sentencing hearing on May 5, 2015 at 10:00 am.

10:32 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Selsing - an agreement has been reached.  Atty Selsing recites agreement, defendant will plea to count 2 on 2014CF57 and count 1 on 2013CF99, balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.  

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 1 as charged on 2013CF99 and count 2 as charged on 2014CF57.  Court orders the balance of the counts on 2013CF99 and 2014CF57 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Court orders a presentence investigation be conducted and filed with the court within 60 days.  Upon filing copies are to be disbursed.  Matter to be set for Sentencing on May 5, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:41 a.m.
Settlement Form (PTC)
Status hearing on February 3, 2015 at 10:00 am.
By Atty John Selsing

10:09 a.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Haase.

Statement by Attorney Haase - will be submitting a petition to withdraw as counsel as he has a conflict of interest with his new position.  Court instructs the defendant he must contact the PD"s office to apply.

Court directs cases be set for Status Hearings approximately thirty days after the first of the year.

Court adjourned at 10:11 a.m.
and Order to Withdraw as Counsel
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.
State's

10:37 a.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Jeffrey Haase present on behalf of the defendant.

2013CF99 - 2014CF57
Statement by Attorney Haase - has received discovery from previous counsel on 2013CF99 - still waiting on 2014CF57.  

Court directs Status Hearings be scheduled.

Court adjourned at 10:39 a.m.
Status hearing on October 21, 2014 at 10:30 am.

2:31 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Haase.

Statement by Attorney Haase - defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives this right.  Court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

ADA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Haase.  Attorney Haase confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties on each count.  Attorney Haase enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.

Court directs Status Hearing to be held in approximately 45 days.

Court adjourned at 2:34 p.m.
Waiver of Prelim on September 9, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

2:06 p.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Jeffrey Haase present on behalf of the defendant.

Statement by Attorney Haase on 2013CF99 has received discovery from the prior attorney - needs to meet with the defendant.  In regards to 2014CF57 can schedule for waiver of preliminary hearing.  

Court directs 2014CF57 be set for waiver of preliminary hearing.

Court adjourned at 2:08 p.m.
Status hearing on August 26, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Inmate Request to the court - Denied, signed by the judge
By Atty Jeffrey Haase

10:04 a.m .  Defendant present in custody and in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Special Prosecutor Chuck Stertz for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Bond has been set.  Statement by Atty Privat - bond has been set over a week ago.  Bond will remain as is.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status in approx 30 days.  Case will be appointed out.  Matter to be set with the other pending case.

Court adjourned at 10:07 a.m.
Defendant is to have No Contact with any juvenile under the age of 18 years with the exception of any court orders issued in juvenile cases.
Defendant is to have No Contact with any juvenile under the age of 18 years with the exception of any court orders issued in juvenile cases.

2:53 p.m.  Defendant in custody and in court with Atty Barbara Privat via video from the Green Lake County Jail.  Special Prosecutor Peter Hahn for the State of Wisconsin.  Special Prosecutor makes bond recommendation.  Court orders bond set at $20,000.00 cash and conditions of:  Defendant is to have No Contact with any juvenile under the age of 18 years with the exception of any court orders issued in juvenile cases.  Status Hearing this monday.

Court adjourned at 2:58 p.m.
